history.content:
You don't actually need to join the club to get involved in learning about cryptocurrencies! We host a DeCal every semester to learn the fundamentals about blockchain and cryptocurrencies (which is open-source if you aren't interested in a formal course), have open events to discuss recent and relevant whitepapers or discuss general trends in the crypto space, regular Meetups with significant people from the industry, and a Slack team open to anyone interested in joining! So many ways to get involved without formally joining the organization.

- Nadir, Co-Head of Education for Blockchain @ Berkeley

children.subject:
Updated: I am interested in joining! Is there more information on that as well?

Thanks!

Go ahead and follow our Facebook page for updates: https://www.facebook.com/BerkeleyBlockchain/, from where you can also find our website and contact information. 

Applications for joining will be out fairly soon, no information is yet out though. We'll also have infosessions in the first week or two, hope to see you at those!
Also, is the application for the decal out yet?
Not yet, but it will be shortly! It'll be clear on FB and feel free to check out decal.berkeley.edu for updates.
Thanks so much! Sorry for so many questions...
Thanks Nadir! Is there anything I can do to get involve before the semester starts?

history.content:
Hi,

I am really interested in cryptocurrency, and I hope to learn more about it. Aside from joining clubs like blockchain at Berkeley, is there any other resources available?

Thanks!
history.subject: Courses, clubs or resources on cryptocurrency
